author: Special Correspondent
text:
Sheetaal Gandhi, National Trainer of JCI India, handling a skill training workshop for members of the Junior Jaycee wing of the Periyar Institute of Management Studies in Salem.

An employability skills training programme marked the inauguration of the Junior Jaycee wing at the Periyar Institute of Management Studies (PRIMS) of Periyar University, recently.

V.R. Palanivelu, Associate Professor, PRIMS, presided and C. Swaminathan, Vice-Chancellor of Periyar University, inaugurated the wing and installed the office-bearers. He stressed on the importance of soft skills to the students, particularly to the MBA graduates to get a decent job or to start a business in the competitive market.

The Vice-Chancellor said that the university provides all the resources that are available to the student community and it is up to the students to take advantage of the opportunities available.

Star Anand, Zone Director, Junior Jaycee Wing, Sugnathi Saravanan, Zone Director –Training of Zone – 17, K. Saravanakumar, president, P. Tamilarasan, secretary, and Vasantha Gomathi, – JCI Salem Metro, offered felicitations.

Sujith, Govindarun, Dhivya, Shama, Najma, Amaran and Suthakar were installed as office-bearers of the PRIMS-Junior Jaycees Wing of JCI Salem Metro.

An employability skills training programme was conducted for the newly inducted members of the Junior Jaycees wing. JCI Senator Sheetaal Gandhi, National Trainer of JCI India, trained the students on the topic “Campus to corporate skills”.
title: Importance of soft skills stressed
